title: Add Dockerfile with CI Build & Publish Workflow
body:
Fixes #19 

Adds a build container with a few caching stages in it to produce a release artifact of `eq_service` to run.

Testing using Ubuntu, [but podman 4](https://askubuntu.com/questions/1414446/whats-the-recommended-way-of-installing-podman-4-in-ubuntu-22-04#1442762) required for BuildKit cache:

```sh
just docker-build
just docker-run
```

- [x] Update README with use
- [x] Use docker instead of podman? Both!
- [x] upstream bug report on libcurl not resulting in SP1 client failure https://github.com/succinctlabs/sp1/issues/2075
- [ ] Define release workflow & run it to get first docker img published.

title: Handle flakey DA better
body:
In cases that we cannot startup the DA client, we **exit the service in an error** 
Added some better logs

title: Add some shutdown and cleanup logic
body:
Helps ensure we don't have a corrupt DB when the service gets a signal to exit/terminate/hangup.

also included some cargo clippy fixes

title: Implement Workaround, use share_get_range instead of blob_get_proof
body:
<!--
Please read and fill out this form before submitting your PR.

Please make sure you have reviewed our contributors guide before submitting your
first PR.
-->

## Overview

there a celestia-node bug with blob_get_proof. The workaround is to use [share_get_range](https://docs.rs/celestia-rpc/latest/celestia_rpc/share/trait.ShareClient.html#method.share_get_range).

title: README includes operational info
body: This isn't _just_ a dev tool ;) - how do you `just` use this thing?

title: Refactor service into `mod`s
body: Mainly for hygiene,also explicitly makes some `OnceCell` items private as we require they are accessed via a `get_or_init` internally.

title: Better handle SP1 errors
body: Fixes #36 (at least in part)

title: Progress on handling errors & retries
body: To try and make the service more robust to most error conditions, we retry on most errors when an incoming RPC call for a failed job comes in.

title: Don't block gRPC while building clients
body:
continues #30 where we attempt to build clients async. We use a `OnceCell` to only build clients once, then pass that single instance around for jobs.

- [x] have the InclusionService contain a pointer to the clients, awaiting the client to be ready on any request to them. 
- [x] spawn a call on program startup to build the clients, so they are ready ASAP for callers.

title: Single client per DA and ZK network client
body:
Fixes #29 

Would ideally also:
- [x] don't block main thread until ready, have running tasks for them that are (ideally) ready before first request to them.
- [x] don't rerun the zk prover setup every time, store it in the db

title: fix program build
body:
## Overview

We put the tonic stuff behind a feature flag called "service", so the proof program doesn't try to build tonic.

title: downgrade versions for zksync compatibility
body:
<!--
Please read and fill out this form before submitting your PR.

Please make sure you have reviewed our contributors guide before submitting your
first PR.
-->

## Overview

ZKStack and Astria use older versions of Prost and Tonic. I tried to ugprade them but that seemed too hard, so I downgraded eq-service, which seems to work nicely.

title: moved generated code to common
body:
## Overview

Moved the generated grpc and proto code to common.

title: Handle DA errors, progress towards allowing retry
body:
Moves to a recursive / self-feeding worker as a state machine to:
- better spread load over thread & between different jobs
- allow for more clear hooks into the job pipeline at any state in the processing of a job end-to-end

Adds some doc comments and a `just doc` command to create (and open them on linux)

Fixes #14

title: Initial docs, `cargo fmt`, and move toward `env` vars over clap
body:
WIP

Initial README (rendered w/ [diagram here](https://github.com/celestiaorg/eq-service/blob/n/init-docs/README.md)) plus some cleanup:

- All cargo deps have minor version pinned (`<Maj>.<Min>`)
- Used https://github.com/bnjbvr/cargo-machete to remove unused deps.
- Ran `cargo fix` to cleanup warnings

Part of a solution for #9

title: feat: add justfile
body:
Mainly to build the workspace enforcing SP1 ELF is present, as if it's not, cargo build fails.

A followup PR will add a README section on how to [install](https://github.com/casey/just?tab=readme-ov-file#installation) and use `just`:

```sh
# one way to install just
cargo install just

# with just installed run:
just
# ^^ lists the commands

just b
# ^^ runs just build & a _pre-build recipe that checks for a required SP1 ELF file to build the project & generates iff needed
```


Opens the door to better devex in setting up, building, and deploying things from this repo.
